TopicTitle: A question about an Eve ascent vehicle

Articles.Content:
To make a lightweight Eve ascent vehicle, if there is such a thing, I decided to use a propellor plane.

So, without sending a test to Eve, I want to know just how high a propellor can lift, because I need to know how big a second stage I need. That’ll change the carrier, so, no paper designs yet.

Edited December 13, 2021 by Wizard Kerbal
Spellyng

You will have to test on Eve, there is a lot of variation on propeller efficiency.

I've built vertical launch craft which were able to get me to 17 km on propeller power alone.  You might be able to get higher using wings.  But for any design you come up with, really the only way to know how high it will go is to actually test it on Eve.

Or, use somebody else's design which has already been tested.

The problem is I have to send an entire plane-rocket that can survive re-entry just for it to fail then I have to do it again a few times. Even trying to open the cheat menu disables achievements on Xbox.

Edited December 13, 2021 by Wizard Kerbal

5 hours ago, Wizard Kerbal said:

Even trying to open the cheat menu disables achievements on Xbox.

Build and test it in a different save then?  Like maybe a sandbox save.

I found I could reliably get to 15 km with my propeller designs. Anything higher I considered a bonus. At 15km the atmosphere on Eve is the same density as sea level on Kerbin, so more engines become viable options. I made this design, and it worked pretty well. Probably should have put a couple parachutes higher up though.
